xccdf12:Benchmark.xccdf12:title: FDCC: Guidance for Securing Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 for IT Professionals
xccdf12:Benchmark.xccdf12:description: This guide has been created to assist IT professionals in effectively securing systems with Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 installed.
xccdf12:Benchmark.xccdf12:notice: Do not attempt to implement any of the settings in this guide without first testing them in a non-operational environment. NIST assumes no responsibility whatsoever for its use by other parties, and makes no guarantees, expressed or implied, about its quality, reliability, or any other characteristic. NIST would appreciate acknowledgement if the document and template are used.
xccdf12:Benchmark.xccdf12:rear-matter:
Trademark Information
Microsoft, Windows, Windows XP, Windows Vista, Internet Explorer, and Windows Firewall are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and other countries.
All other names are registered trademarks or trademarks of their respective companies.

xccdf12:reference.dc:publisher: National Institute of Standards and Technology

xccdf12:metadata.dc:creator: Creator, The
xccdf12:metadata.dc:publisher: National Institute of Standards and Technology
xccdf12:metadata.dc:contributor: National Institute of Standards and Technology

xccdf12:Profile.xccdf12:title: 800-53 Low
xccdf12:Profile.xccdf12:description: This profile selects specific controls that are recommended by Special Publication 800-53 for information systems in which all three security objectives (i.e., confidentiality, integrity, and availability) are assigned a FIPS 199 potential impact value of low. Each control has an effect on other groups within this document as individual rule require certain controls to be selected.

xccdf12:Profile.xccdf12:title: 800-53 Moderate
xccdf12:Profile.xccdf12:description: This profile selects specific controls that are recommended by Special Publication 800-53 for information systems in which at least one security objectives (i.e., confidentiality, integrity, and availability) are assigned a FIPS 199 potential impact value of moderate and no security objective is assigned a FIPS 199 potential impact value of high. Each control has an effect on other groups within this document as individual rule require certain controls to be selected.

xccdf12:Profile.xccdf12:title: 800-53 High
xccdf12:Profile.xccdf12:description: This profile selects specific controls that are recommended by Special Publication 800-53 for information systems in which at least one security objectives (i.e., confidentiality, integrity, and availability) are assigned a FIPS 199 potential impact value of high. Each control has an effect on other groups within this document as individual rule require certain controls to be selected.

xccdf12:Profile.xccdf12:title: 800-53 All
xccdf12:Profile.xccdf12:description: This profile selects all the security controls that are recommended by Special Publication 800-53 for information systems. Each control has an effect on other groups within this document as individual rule require certain controls to be selected.

xccdf12:Profile.xccdf12:title: Federal Desktop Core Configuration version 1.2.1.0
xccdf12:Profile.xccdf12:description: This profile represents guidance outlined by the Federal Core Configuration for a desktop system with Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 installed.

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Account Management
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:reference: GAO FISCAM: AC-2.1 AC-2.2, AC-3.2, SP-4.1

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Access Enforcement
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:reference: DOD 8500.2: DCFA-1, ECAN-1, EBRU-1, PRNK-1, ECCD-1, ECSD-2
DCID 6/3: Discretionary Access Control (DAC): 4.B.2.a(2), Mandatory Access Control (MAC): 4.B.4.a(3)

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Supervision and Review of Access Control
Permitted Actions without Identification or Authentication
Access Control for Portable and Mobile Systems
Security Awareness and Training Policy and Procedures
Contacts with Security Groups and Associations
Audit and Accountability Policy and Procedures
Applicable 800-53 Certification, Accreditation, and Security Assessment
Certification, Accreditation, and Security Assessment Policies and Procedures
Information System Connections
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:reference: DOD 8500.2: DCID-1, EBCR-1 EBRU-1, EBPW-1, ECIC-1

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Baseline Configuration and System Component Inventory
Identification and Authentication Policy and Procedures
Physical and Environmental Protection Policy and Procedures
System and Services Acquisition Policy and Procedures
Information System Documentation
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:reference: DOD 8500.2: DCCS-1, DCHW-1, DCID-1, DCSD-1, DCSW-1, ECND-1, DCFA-1

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: System and Communications Protection Policy and Procedures
Secure Name Address Resolution Service (Authoritative Source)
Architecture and Provisioning for Name/Address Resolution Service
System and Information Integrity Policy and Procedures
Information System Monitoring Tools and Techniques
Information Accuracy, Completeness, Validity, and Authenticity
Introduction
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description:
This guide has been created to assist federal agencies in effectively securing systems with Microsoft Windows Internet Explorer 7 based on OMB Federal Desktop Core Configuration recommendations.
Under the direction of OMB and in collaboration with DHS, DISA, NSA, USAF, and Microsoft, NIST has provided the following baseline to help agencies test, implement, and deploy the Microsoft Windows Internet Explorer 7 Federal Desktop Core Configuration (FDCC) baseline. The Federal Desktop Core Configuration (FDCC) is an OMB-mandated security configuration.
Please refer to the FDCC home page for additional information. http://fdcc.nist.gov

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: FDCC Other Settings
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: FDCC has identified the following additional controls that must be checked in order to verify compliance.

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Core Policy
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: The following are some additional settings for Microsoft Internet Explorer 7

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Disable "Configuring History" - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This setting specifies the number of days that Internet Explorer keeps track of the pages viewed in the History List. The delete Browsing History option can be accessed using Tools, Internet Options and General tab.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Disable Automatic Install of Internet Explorer Components - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This Disable Automatic Install of Internet Explorer components setting prevents Internet Explorer from automatically installing components.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Disable Changing Automatic Configuration Settings - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This Disable Automatic Install of Internet Explorer components setting prevents Internet Explorer from automatically installing components.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Disable Periodic Check For Internet Explorer Software Updates - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The Disable Periodic Check for Internet Explorer software updates setting prevents Internet Explorer from more frequently checking whether a new browser update is available.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Disable Showing the Splash Screen - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The Disable showing the splash screen setting prevents the Internet Explorer splash screen from appearing when users start the browser. Enabling this policy causes the splash screen, which normally displays the program name, licensing, and copyright information

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Disable Software Update Shell Notifications on Program Launch - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The Disable software update shell notifications on program launch setting specifies that programs using the Microsoft Software Distribution Channel will not notify users when they install new components.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Do Not Allow Users to enable or Disable Add-Ons - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The Do not allow users to enable or disable add-ons policy setting allows you to manage whether users have the ability to allow or deny add-ons through Manage Add-ons. If you configure this policy setting to Enabled, users cannot enable or disable add-ons. This item is disabled.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Make proxy settings per-machine (rather than per-user) - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The Make proxy settings per � machine (rather than per-user) setting ensures proxy settings for all users of the same computer are the same.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Prevent participation in the Customer Experience Improvement Programs - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting prevents users from participating in the Customer Experience Improvement Program (CEIP).

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Prevent performance of First Run Customize settings - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting prevents performance of the First Run Customize settings ability and controls what the user will see when they launch Internet Explorer for the first time after installation of Internet Explorer.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Security Zones: Do Not Allow Users to Add/Delete Sites - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The Security Zones: Do not allow users to add/delete sites setting prevents users from adding or removing sites from security zones. A security zone is a group of Web sites with the same security level.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Security Zones: Do Not Allow Users to Change Policies - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The Security Zones: Do not allow users to change policies setting prevents users from changing security zone settings. A security zone is a group of Web sites with the same security level.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Security Zones: Use Only Machine Settings - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Applies security zone information to all users of the same computer. A security zone is a group of Web sites with the same security level. If you enable this policy, changes that the user makes to a security zone will apply to all users of that computer.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn Off "Delete Browsing History" functionality - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting prevents users from performing the "Delete Browsing History" action in Internet Explorer. If you enable this policy setting, users cannot perform the "Delete Browsing History" action in Internet Options for Internet Explorer 7.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn Off Crash Detection - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The Turn off Crash Detection policy setting allows you to manage the crash detection feature of add-on management in Internet Explorer.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn Off Managing Phishing Filter - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows the user to enable a phishing filter that will warn if the Web site being visited is known for fraudulent attempts to gather personal information through "phishing."

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn Off the Security Settings Check Feature - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting turns off the Security Settings Check feature, which checks Internet Explorer security settings to determine when the settings put Internet Explorer at risk.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Prevent ignoring certificate errors - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Internet Explorer treats as fatal any Secure Socket Layer/Transport Layer Security (SSL/TLS) certificate errors that interrupt navigation (such as "expired," "revoked," or "name mismatch" errors).

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel

xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:title: Allow active content from CDs to run on user machines - Local Computer - variable
xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:description: Allow Active Content from CD's to Run on User Machine - Local Computer - variable

xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:title: Allow Install OnDemand (Internet Explorer) - Local Computer - variable
Allow Software to Run or Install Even if the Signature is Invalid - Local Computer - variable
xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:description: Allow Software to Run or Install Even if the Signature is Invalid - Local Computer - variable

xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:title: Allow Software to Run or Install Even if the Signature is Invalid - Local Computer - variable
xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:description: Allow Software to Run or Install Even if the Signature is Invalid - Local Computer - variable

xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:title: Allow Third-Party Browser Extensions - Local Computer - variable
xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:description: Allow Third-Party Browser Extensions - Local Computer - variable

xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:title: Check for Server Certificate Revocation - Local Computer - variable
xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:description: Check for Server Certificate Revocation - Local Computer - variable

xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:title: Check for signatures on downloaded programs - Local Computer - variable
xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:description: Check for Signature on Downloaded Programs - Local Computer - variable

xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:title: Do Not Allow Resetting Internet Explorer Settings - Local Computer - variable
xccdf12:Value.xccdf12:description: Do Not Allow Resetting Internet Explorer Settings - Local Computer - variable

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow Active Content from CDs to Run on User Machine - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users receive a dialog requesting permission for active content on a CD to run. If you enable this policy setting, active content on a CD will run without a prompt.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow Install On Demand (Internet Explorer)
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The "Allow Install On Demand (Internet Explorer)" setting should be configured correctly.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow Software to Run or Install Even if the Signature is Invalid - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Microsoft ActiveX controls and file downloads often have digital signatures attached that vouch for both the file's integrity and the identity of the signer (creator) of the software. Such signatures help ensure that unmodified.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow Third-Party Browser Extensions - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer will launch COM add-ons known as browser helper objects, such as toolbars.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Automatically Check for Internet Explorer Updates - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer checks the Internet for newer versions.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Check for Server Certificate Revocation - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer will check revocation status of servers' certificates.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Check for signatures on downloaded programs - Local Computer - variable
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer checks for digital signatures (which identifies the publisher of signed software and verifies it hasn't been modified or tampered with) on user computers before downloading executable programs.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Do Not Allow Resetting Internet Explorer Settings - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting prevents users from using the Reset Internet Explorer Settings feature. Reset Internet Explorer Settings will allow the users to reset all settings changed since install, delete browsing history and disable add-ons that are not preapproved.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Intranet Sites: Include all network paths (UNCs) - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting controls whether URLs representing UNCs are mapped into the local Intranet security zone. If you enable this policy setting, all network paths are mapped into the Intranet Zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Site to Zone Assignment List
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Computer-wide, rather than per-user, assignment of sites to zones for Internet Explorer should be enabled or disabled as appropriate.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Access Data Sources Across Domains - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer can access data from another security zone using the Microsoft XML Parser (MSXML) or ActiveX Data Objects (ADO).

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow cut, copy or paste operations from the clipboard via script - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether scripts can perform a clipboard operation (for example, cut, copy, and paste) in a specified region. If you enable this policy setting, a script can perform a clipboard operation.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow drag and drop or copy and paste files - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can drag files or copy and paste files from a source within the zone. If you enable this policy setting, users can drag files or copy and paste files from this zone automatically.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow Font Downloads - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether pages of the zone may download HTML fonts. If you enable this policy setting, HTML fonts can be downloaded automatically.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow installation of desktop items - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can install Active Desktop items from this zone. The settings for this option are: If you enable this policy setting, users can install desktop items from this zone automatically.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow script-initiated windows without size or position constraints - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage restrictions on script-initiated pop-up windows and windows that include the title and status bars. If you enable this policy setting, Windows Restrictions security will not apply in this zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow Scriptlets - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether scriptlets can be allowed. If you enable this policy setting, users will be able to run scriptlets. If you disable this policy setting, users will not be able to run scriptlets.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow status bar updates via script - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether script is allowed to update the status bar within the zone. If you enable this policy setting, script is allowed to update the status bar.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Automatic prompting for file downloads - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting determines whether users will be prompted for non user-initiated file downloads. Regardless of this setting, users will receive file download dialogs for user-initiated downloads.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Download signed ActiveX controls - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users may download signed ActiveX controls from a page in the zone. If you enable this policy, users can download signed controls without user intervention.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Download unsigned ActiveX controls - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users may download unsigned ActiveX controls from the zone. Such code is potentially harmful, especially when coming from an untrusted zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Initialize and script ActiveX controls not marked as safe - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage ActiveX controls not marked as safe. If you enable this policy setting, ActiveX controls are run, loaded with parameters, and scripted without setting object safety for untrusted data or scripts.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Java permissions - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Launching applications and files in an IFRAME - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether applications may be run and files may be downloaded from an IFRAME reference in the HTML of the pages in this zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Logon Options - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage settings for logon options. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose from the following logon options.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Loose or un-compiled XAML files - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: These are eXtensible Application Markup Language (XAML) files. XAML is an XML-based declarative markup language commonly used for creating rich user interfaces and graphics that leverage the Windows Presentation Foundation.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Navigate sub-frames across different domains - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage the opening of sub-frames and access of applications across different domains. If you enable this policy setting, users can open sub-frames from other domains and access applications from other domains.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Open files based on content, not file extension - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage MIME sniffing for file promotion from one type to another based on a MIME sniff. A MIME sniff is the recognition by Internet Explorer of the file type based on a bit signature.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Software channel permissions - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage software channel permissions. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose the following options from the drop-down box.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn Off First-Run Opt-In - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Turn Off First-Run Opt-In

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn On Protected Mode - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The "Turn on Protected Mode" setting should be configured correctly for the Internet Zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Use Pop-up Blocker - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether unwanted pop-up windows appear. Pop-up windows that are opened when the end user clicks a link are not blocked. If you enable this policy setting, most unwanted pop-up windows are prevented from appearing.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Userdata Persistence - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage the preservation of information in the browser's history, in favorites, in an XML store, or directly within a Web page saved to disk.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Web Browser Applications - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: These are browser-hosted, ClickOnce-deployed applications built using WinFX. These applications execute in a security sandbox and harness the power of the Windows Presentation Foundation platform for the Web.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Web sites in less privileged Web content zones can navigate into this zone - Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Web sites from less privileged zones, such as Restricted Sites, can navigate into this zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Display Mixed Content - Intranet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can display nonsecure items and manage whether users receive a security information message to display pages containing both secure and nonsecure items.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Intranet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Java permissions - Intranet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Intranet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Display Mixed Content - Local Machine Zone - Local Compute
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can display nonsecure items and manage whether users receive a security information message to display pages containing both secure and nonsecure items.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Local Machine Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Java permissions - Local Machine Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Local Machine Zone

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Locked Down Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: Locked Down Internet Zone - Local Computer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Display Mixed Content - Locked Down Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can display nonsecure items and manage whether users receive a security information message to display pages containing both secure and nonsecure items.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Download Signed ActiveX Controls - Locked Down Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The "Download signed ActiveX controls" setting should be configured correctly for the Locked-Down Internet Zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Internet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Java permissions - Locked Down Internet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Internet Zone

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Locked Down Intranet Zone - Local Computer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Display Mixed Content - Locked Down Intranet Zone - Local Compute
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can display nonsecure items and manage whether users receive a security information message to display pages containing both secure and nonsecure items.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Intranet Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Java permissions - Locked Down Intranet Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Intranet Zone

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Locked Down Local Machine Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: Locked Down Local Machine Zone - Local Computer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Display Mixed Content - Locked Down Local Machine Zone - Local Compute
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can display nonsecure items and manage whether users receive a security information message to display pages containing both secure and nonsecure items.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Local Machine Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Java permissions - Locked Down Local Machine - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Local Machine Zone

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Locked Down Restricted Sites Zone - Local Compute - Local Computer
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: Locked Down Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Display Mixed Content - Locked Down Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can display nonsecure items and manage whether users receive a security information message to display pages containing both secure and nonsecure items.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Java permissions - Locked Down Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Locked Down Trusted Sites Zone - Local Computer - Local Compute
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: Locked Down Trusted Sites Zone - Local Computer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow Status Bar Updates Via Script - Locked Down Trusted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The "Allow status bar updates via script" setting should be configured correctly for the Locked-Down Trusted Sites Zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Trusted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Display Mixed Content - Locked Down Trusted Sites Zone - LocalComputer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can display nonsecure items and manage whether users receive a security information message to display pages containing both secure and nonsecure items.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Trusted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Java permissions - Locked Down Trusted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Locked-Down Trusted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Access Data Sources Across Domains - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer can access data from another security zone using the Microsoft XML Parser (MSXML) or ActiveX Data Objects (ADO).

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow Active Scripting - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether script code on pages in the zone is run. If you enable this policy setting, script code on pages in the zone can run automatically.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow Binary and Script Behaviors - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage dynamic binary and script behaviors: components that encapsulate specific functionality for HTML elements to which they were attached. If you enable this policy setting, binary and script behaviors are available.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow cut, copy or paste operations from the clipboard via script - Restricted SitesZone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether scripts can perform a clipboard operation (for example, cut, copy, and paste) in a specified region. If you enable this policy setting, a script can perform a clipboard operation.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow drag and drop or copy and paste files - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can drag files or copy and paste files from a source within the zone. If you enable this policy setting, users can drag files or copy and paste files from this zone automatically.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow File Downloads - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether file downloads are permitted from the zone. This option is determined by the zone of the page with the link causing the download, not the zone from which the file is delivered.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow Font Downloads - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether pages of the zone may download HTML fonts. If you enable this policy setting, HTML fonts can be downloaded automatically.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow installation of desktop items - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can install Active Desktop items from this zone. The settings for this option are: If you enable this policy setting, users can install desktop items from this zone automatically.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow META REFRESH - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether a user's browser can be redirected to another Web page if the author of the Web page uses the Meta Refresh setting (tag) to redirect browsers to another Web page.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow script-initiated windows without size or position constraints - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage restrictions on script-initiated pop-up windows and windows that include the title and status bars. If you enable this policy setting, Windows Restrictions security will not apply in this zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Allow status bar updates via script - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether script is allowed to update the status bar within the zone. If you enable this policy setting, script is allowed to update the status bar.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Automatic prompting for file downloads - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting determines whether users will be prompted for non user-initiated file downloads. Regardless of this setting, users will receive file download dialogs for user-initiated downloads.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Download signed ActiveX controls - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users may download signed ActiveX controls from a page in the zone. If you enable this policy, users can download signed controls without user intervention.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Download unsigned ActiveX controls - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users may download unsigned ActiveX controls from the zone. Such code is potentially harmful, especially when coming from an untrusted zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Initialize and script ActiveX controls not marked as safe - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage ActiveX controls not marked as safe. If you enable this policy setting, ActiveX controls are run, loaded with parameters, and scripted without setting object safety for untrusted data or scripts.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Java permissions - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Launching applications and files in an IFRAME - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether applications may be run and files may be downloaded from an IFRAME reference in the HTML of the pages in this zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Logon Options - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage settings for logon options. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose from the following logon options.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Loose or un-compiled XAML files - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: These are eXtensible Application Markup Language (XAML) files. XAML is an XML-based declarative markup language commonly used for creating rich user interfaces and graphics that leverage the Windows Presentation Foundation.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Navigate sub-frames across different domains - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage the opening of sub-frames and access of applications across different domains. If you enable this policy setting, users can open sub-frames from other domains and access applications from other domains.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Open files based on content, not file extension - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage MIME sniffing for file promotion from one type to another based on a MIME sniff. A MIME sniff is the recognition by Internet Explorer of the file type based on a bit signature.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Run .NET Framework-reliant components not signed with Authenticode - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether .NET Framework components that are not signed with Authenticode can be executed from Internet Explorer.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Run .NET Framework-reliant components signed with Authenticode - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether .NET Framework components that are signed with Authenticode can be executed from Internet Explorer.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Run ActiveX controls and plugins - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether ActiveX controls and plug-ins can be run on pages from the specified zone. If you enable this policy setting, controls and plug-ins can run without user intervention.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Script ActiveX controls marked safe for scripting - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether an ActiveX control marked safe for scripting can interact with a script. If you enable this policy setting, script interaction can occur automatically without user intervention.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Scripting of Java Applets - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether applets are exposed to scripts within the zone. If you enable this policy setting, scripts can access applets automatically without user intervention.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Software channel permissions - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage software channel permissions. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose the following options from the drop-down box.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn Off First-Run Opt-In - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Turn Off First-Run Opt-In

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn On Protected Mode - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The "Turn on Protected Mode" setting should be configured correctly for the Restricted Sites Zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Use Pop-up Blocker - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether unwanted pop-up windows appear. Pop-up windows that are opened when the end user clicks a link are not blocked.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Userdata Persistence - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage the preservation of information in the browser's history, in favorites, in an XML store, or directly within a Web page saved to disk.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Web Browser Applications - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: These are browser-hosted, ClickOnce-deployed applications built using WinFX. These applications execute in a security sandbox and harness the power of the Windows Presentation Foundation platform for the Web.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Web sites in less privileged Web content zones can navigate into this zone - Restricted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Web sites from less privileged zones, such as Restricted Sites, can navigate into this zone.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Trusted Sites Zone - Local Computer - Local Compute

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Display Mixed Content - Trusted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can display nonsecure items and manage whether users receive a security information message to display pages containing both secure and nonsecure items.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Trusted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Java permissions - Trusted Sites Zone - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Trusted Sites Zone

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Periodic Check for Updates - Local Computer
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: Periodic Check for Updates to Internet Explorer and Internet Tools - Local Computer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn Off changing the URL to be displayed for checking updates to Internet Explorer and Internet Tools - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting allows checking for updates for Internet Explorer from the specified URL, included by default in Internet Explorer.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Settings\Component Updates\Periodic check for updates to Internet Explorer and Internet Tools

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn Off Configuring the Update Check Interval (In Days) - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This setting specifies the update check interval. The default value is 30 days. If you enable this policy setting, the user will not be able to configure the update check interval. You have to specify the update check interval.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Settings\Component Updates\Periodic check for updates to Internet Explorer and Internet Tools

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Enable Native XMLHttp Support - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Enable Native XMLHttp Support - Local Computer

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Internet Explorer Processes - Consistent Mime Handling - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Internet Explorer uses Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) data to determine file handling procedures for files received through a Web server.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\Consistent Mime Handling

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Mime Sniffing Safety Feature - Local Computer
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: Mime Sniffing Safety Feature - Local Computer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Internet Explorer Processes - Mime Sniffing Safety Feature - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: MIME sniffing is the process of examining the content of a MIME file to determine its context � whether it is a data file, an executable file, or some other type of file.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\Mime Sniffing Safety Feature

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: MK Protocol Security Restriction - Local Computer
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: MK Protocol Security Restriction - Local Computer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Internet Explorer Processes - MK Protocol Security Restriction - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The MK Protocol Security Restriction policy setting reduces attack surface area by blocking the seldom used MK protocol. Some older Web applications use the MK protocol to retrieve information from compressed files.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\MK Protocol Security Restriction

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Protection From Zone Elevation - Local Computer
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: Protection From Zone Elevation - Local Computer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Internet Explorer Processes - Protection From Zone Elevation - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Internet Explorer places restrictions on each Web page it opens that are dependent upon the location of the Web page (such as Internet zone, Intranet zone, or Local Machine zone).

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\Protection From Zone Elevation

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Internet Explorer Processes - Restrict ActiveX Install - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The Restrict ActiveX Install\Internet Explorer Processes policy setting enables blocking of ActiveX control installation prompts for Internet Explorer processes.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\Restrict ActiveX Install

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Internet Explorer Processes - Restrict File Download - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: In certain circumstances, Web sites can initiate file download prompts without interaction from users. This technique can allow Web sites to put unauthorized files on users' hard drives if they click the wrong button and accept the download.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\Restrict File Download

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Scripted Window Security Restrictions - Local Computer
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: Scripted Window Security Restrictions - Local Computer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Internet Explorer Processes - Scripted Window Security Restrictions - Local Computer
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Internet Explorer allows scripts to programmatically open, resize, and reposition various types of windows. Often, disreputable Web sites will resize windows to either hide other windows or force you to interact with a window that contains malicious code.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Security Features\Scripted Window Security Restrictions

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn off downloading of enclosures
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Turn off downloading of enclosures

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\RSS Feeds

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Configure Outlook Express - Local User
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: The Configure Outlook Express setting allows administrators to enable and disable the ability for Microsoft Outlook Express users to save or open attachments that can potentially contain a virus.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Disable AutoComplete for forms - Local User
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This AutoComplete feature suggests possible matches when users are filling up forms. If you enable this setting, the user is not suggested matches when filling forms. The user cannot change it.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Disable external branding of Internet Explorer - Local User
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Prevents branding of Internet programs, such as customization of Internet Explorer and Outlook Express logos and title bars, by another party.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Disable Internet Connection wizard - Local User
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Prevents users from running the Internet Connection Wizard.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Disable the Reset Web Settings feature - Local User
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Prevents users from restoring default settings for home and search pages. If you enable this policy, the Reset Web Settings button on the Programs tab in the Internet Options dialog box appears dimmed.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn on the auto-complete feature for user names and passwords on forms - Local User
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This AutoComplete feature can remember and suggest User names and passwords on Forms. If you enable this setting, the user cannot change "User name and passwords on forms" or "prompt me to save passwords".

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn off page transitions - Local User
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting specifies if, as you move from one Web page to another, Internet Explorer fades out of the page you are leaving and fades into the page to which you are going. If you enable this policy setting, page transitions will be turned off.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Settings\Advanced Settings\Browsing

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Turn on the Internet Connection Wizard Auto Detect - Local User
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: This policy setting determines if the Internet Connection Wizard was completed. If it was not completed, it launches the Internet Connection Wizard.

xccdf12:reference.dc:source: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Internet Settings\Advanced Settings\Internet Connection Wizard Settings

xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:title: Security Patches
xccdf12:Group.xccdf12:description: Securing a given computer has become increasingly important. As such, it is essential to keep a host up to current patch levels to eliminate known vulnerabilities and weaknesses. In conjunction with antivirus software and a personal firewall, patching goes a long way to securing a host against outside attacks and exploitation. Microsoft provides two mechanisms for distributing security updates: Automatic Updates and Microsoft Update. In smaller environments, either method may be sufficient for keeping systems current with patches. Other environments typically have a software change management control process or a patch management program that tests patches before deploying them; distribution may then occur through local Windows Update Services (WUS) or Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) servers, which provide approved security patches for use by the Automatic Updates feature.

xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:title: Security Patches Up-To-Date
xccdf12:Rule.xccdf12:description: Keep systems up to current patch levels to eliminate known vulnerabilities and weaknesses.
